refnamediv.refpurpose: Generator for loading kernel modules at boot

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: systemd-modules-load-generator is a generator that automatically instantiates modprobe@.service to load kernel modules during early boot. It reads static configuration from files in /usr/ and /etc/, but also runtime configuration from /run/ and the kernel command line (see below).
See modules-load.d5 for information about the configuration format of this generator and paths where configuration files can be created.

Instances of modprobe@.service are collectively contained in the modprobe.slice unit, whose ConcurrencySoftMax= property can be used to limit the number of probes running in parallel. Also see systemd.slice5 and systemd.special7.

refsect1.title: Kernel Command Line
refsect1.para: systemd-modules-load-generator understands the following kernel-command-line7 parameters:

listitem.para: Takes a comma-separated list of kernel modules to statically load during early boot. The option prefixed with rd. is read in the initrd only.
